member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER
member.summary: Represents the optional header format.

summary.para: The state of the image file. This member can be one of the following values.

listheader.description: The file is an executable image. This value is defined as IMAGE_NT_OPTIONAL_HDR32_MAGIC in a 32-bit application and as IMAGE_NT_OPTIONAL_HDR64_MAGIC in a 64-bit application.
The file is an executable image.
The file is an executable image.
The file is a ROM image.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.MajorLinkerVersion
member.summary: The major version number of the linker.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.MinorLinkerVersion
member.summary: The minor version number of the linker.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.SizeOfCode
member.summary: The size of the code section, in bytes, or the sum of all such sections if there are multiple code sections.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.SizeOfInitializedData
member.summary: The size of the initialized data section, in bytes, or the sum of all such sections if there are multiple initialized data sections.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.SizeOfUninitializedData
member.summary: The size of the uninitialized data section, in bytes, or the sum of all such sections if there are multiple uninitialized data sections.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.AddressOfEntryPoint
member.summary: A pointer to the entry point function, relative to the image base address. For executable files, this is the starting address. For device drivers, this is the address of the initialization function. The entry point function is optional for DLLs. When no entry point is present, this member is zero.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.BaseOfCode
member.summary: A pointer to the beginning of the code section, relative to the image base.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.BaseOfData
member.summary: A pointer to the beginning of the data section, relative to the image base.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.ImageBase
member.summary: The preferred address of the first byte of the image when it is loaded in memory. This value is a multiple of 64K bytes. The default value for DLLs is 0x10000000. The default value for applications is 0x00400000, except on Windows CE where it is 0x00010000.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.SectionAlignment
member.summary: The alignment of sections loaded in memory, in bytes. This value must be greater than or equal to theFileAlignment member. The default value is the page size for the system.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.FileAlignment
member.summary: The alignment of the raw data of sections in the image file, in bytes. The value should be a power of 2 between 512 and 64K (inclusive). The default is 512. If the SectionAlignment member is less than the system page size, this member must be the same asSectionAlignment.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.MajorOperatingSystemVersion
member.summary: The major version number of the required operating system.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.MinorOperatingSystemVersion
member.summary: The minor version number of the required operating system.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.MajorImageVersion
member.summary: The major version number of the image.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.MinorImageVersion
member.summary: The minor version number of the image.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.MajorSubsystemVersion
member.summary: The major version number of the subsystem.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.MinorSubsystemVersion
member.summary: The minor version number of the subsystem.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.Win32VersionValue
member.summary: This member is reserved and must be 0.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.SizeOfImage
member.summary: The size of the image, in bytes, including all headers. Must be a multiple ofSectionAlignment.

summary.para: The combined size of the following items, rounded to a multiple of the value specified in theFileAlignment member.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.CheckSum
member.summary: The image file checksum. The following files are validated at load time: all drivers, any DLL loaded at boot time, and any DLL loaded into a critical system process.

summary.para: The subsystem required to run this image. The following values are defined.

listheader.description: No subsystem required (device drivers and native system processes).

summary.para: The DLL characteristics of the image. The following values are defined.

listheader.description: The DLL can be relocated at load time.

Code integrity checks are forced. If you set this flag and a section contains only uninitialized data, set the PointerToRawData member of for that section to zero; otherwise, the image will fail to load because the digital signature cannot be verified.
The image is compatible with data execution prevention (DEP).
The image is isolation aware, but should not be isolated.
The image does not use structured exception handling (SEH). No handlers can be called in this image.
Image should execute in an AppContainer.
The image is terminal server aware.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.SizeOfStackReserve
member.summary: The number of bytes to reserve for the stack. Only the memory specified by theSizeOfStackCommit member is committed at load time; the rest is made available one page at a time until this reserve size is reached.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.SizeOfStackCommit
member.summary: The number of bytes to commit for the stack.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.SizeOfHeapReserve
member.summary: The number of bytes to reserve for the local heap. Only the memory specified by theSizeOfHeapCommit member is committed at load time; the rest is made available one page at a time until this reserve size is reached.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.SizeOfHeapCommit
member.summary: The number of bytes to commit for the local heap.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.LoaderFlags
member.summary: This member is obsolete.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.NumberOfRvaAndSizes
member.summary: The number of directory entries in the remainder of the optional header. Each entry describes a location and size.

summary.para: A pointer to the first structure in the data directory.
The index number of the desired directory entry. This parameter can be one of the following values.

listheader.description: The relative virtual address of global pointer

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER
member.summary: Represents the optional header format.

summary.para: The state of the image file. This member can be one of the following values.

listheader.description: The file is an executable image. This value is defined as IMAGE_NT_OPTIONAL_HDR32_MAGIC in a 32-bit application and as IMAGE_NT_OPTIONAL_HDR64_MAGIC in a 64-bit application.
The file is an executable image.
The file is an executable image.
The file is a ROM image.

member.summary: A pointer to the entry point function, relative to the image base address. For executable files, this is the starting address. For device drivers, this is the address of the initialization function. The entry point function is optional for DLLs. When no entry point is present, this member is zero.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.BaseOfCode

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.ImageBase
member.summary: The preferred address of the first byte of the image when it is loaded in memory. This value is a multiple of 64K bytes. The default value for DLLs is 0x10000000. The default value for applications is 0x00400000, except on Windows CE where it is 0x00010000.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.SectionAlignment
member.summary: The alignment of sections loaded in memory, in bytes. This value must be greater than or equal to theFileAlignment member. The default value is the page size for the system.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.FileAlignment
member.summary: The alignment of the raw data of sections in the image file, in bytes. The value should be a power of 2 between 512 and 64K (inclusive). The default is 512. If the SectionAlignment member is less than the system page size, this member must be the same asSectionAlignment.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.MajorImageVersion
member.summary: The major version number of the image.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.SizeOfImage
member.summary: The size of the image, in bytes, including all headers. Must be a multiple ofSectionAlignment.

summary.para: The combined size of the following items, rounded to a multiple of the value specified in theFileAlignment member.

member.name: IMAGE_OPTIONAL_HEADER.CheckSum
member.summary: The image file checksum. The following files are validated at load time: all drivers, any DLL loaded at boot time, and any DLL loaded into a critical system process.

summary.para: The subsystem required to run this image. The following values are defined.

listheader.description: No subsystem required (device drivers and native system processes).

summary.para: The DLL characteristics of the image. The following values are defined.

listheader.description: The DLL can be relocated at load time.

Code integrity checks are forced. If you set this flag and a section contains only uninitialized data, set the PointerToRawData member of for that section to zero; otherwise, the image will fail to load because the digital signature cannot be verified.
The image is compatible with data execution prevention (DEP).
The image is isolation aware, but should not be isolated.
The image does not use structured exception handling (SEH). No handlers can be called in this image.
The image is terminal server aware.

member.summary: The number of bytes to reserve for the stack. Only the memory specified by theSizeOfStackCommit member is committed at load time; the rest is made available one page at a time until this reserve size is reached.

member.summary: The number of bytes to reserve for the local heap. Only the memory specified by theSizeOfHeapCommit member is committed at load time; the rest is made available one page at a time until this reserve size is reached.

member.summary: The number of bytes to commit for the local heap.
